#Text=3. Laser Point Clouds Classification Using Multi-Scale PBA Image Features and Point Cloud Features
#Text=It is important to select the neighborhood range of the laser points in the feature extraction step .
#Text=In our work , the image pyramid model is adopted to extract the texture features of PBA images on multiple scales .
#Text=The point cloud pyramid model is then used to extract the local features of the 3D point cloud on multiple scales .
#Text=3.1 .
#Text=Multi-Scale PBA Image Feature Extraction
#Text=In our work , feature extraction is accomplished in 2D gray images on multiple scales .
#Text=When the scale is large , the computational cost is very high .
#Text=Therefore , the PBA image is downsampled by using the image pyramid model .
#Text=The image pyramid model for PBA images is given in
#Text=Figure 8
#Text=.
#Text=It should be noted that the image in each layer of the pyramid model is generated directly from the 3D laser point cloud , rather than from the downsampling of the original image .
#Text=Local Binary Pattern ( LBP ) is a kind of image texture feature , which is extracted from multi-resolution PBA images .
#Text=For the classic LBP feature , eight fixed neighborhood pixels are selected ( see
#Text=Figure 9
#Text=a ) .

#Text=In order to extract multi-scale texture features an improved neighborhood selection method is adopted for LBP feature extraction in our work , in which a circular neighborhood is selected with variable radius r .
#Text=The pixel coordinate of the neighborhood points ( xp , yp ) can be obtained as follows : ( 6 ) where ( xc , yc ) is the pixel coordinate of the center pixel .
#Text=As shown in
#Text=Figure 9
#Text=a , b , r is selected as 1 and 2 , respectively .

#Text=Reduce the original 256-level gray PBA image to 3-level and the pixel gray value Gnew of the simplified 3-level image can be obtained as follows : ( 7 ) where Gold is the pixel gray value of the original PBA image .
#Text=Figure 10

#Text=shows an example of the simplified 3-level PBA image ( black-0 ; gray-127 ; white-255 ) , and four categories of typical local scenes also show distinct texture features , which are artificial ground ( top left ) , natural ground ( bottom left ) , buildings ( top right ) , and vegetation ( bottom right ) .
#Text=When feature extraction in different layers of the image pyramid model for the PBA images is completed , these features in different layers need to be fused .
#Text=Starting from the top layer image of the pyramid , the image features are upsampled , and then superimposed with the image features of the next layer .
#Text=These two steps are repeated until the features in all layers are superimposed on the image at the bottom layer of the image pyramid model .
#Text=In summary , the ( P + 1 ) layer image pyramid model of PBA images is built from the original laser point cloud , and each layer of PBA images is converted to a 3-level gray image .
#Text=LBP features are then extracted in each image pixel on m scales .
#Text=Finally , the features in different layers are superimposed together from the top layer to the bottom layer .
#Text=Therefore , there are m × ( P + 1 ) image features for every pixel in the original PBA image .
#Text=3.2 .
#Text=Multi-Scale Point Cloud Feature Extraction
#Text=In our work , features are extracted from 3D laser point clouds on multiple scales .

#Text=However , when the neighborhood radius is expanded at a linear rate , the number of neighborhood points of a laser point is approximately increased at a cubic speed , which greatly increases the computational burden .
#Text=In order to solve this problem , the point cloud pyramid model is derived which is inspired by the image pyramid model in image processing .
#Text=Similar to the image pyramid model , the downsampling algorithm is utilized for the original point clouds to build the point cloud pyramid model .
#Text=The voxel model is used to divide the laser point cloud to be downsampled into different 3D grids .
#Text=Then the center of gravity of the laser points in each voxel ( 3D grid ) is calculated to represent all the points in the voxel .
#Text=An illustration of the point cloud pyramid model is shown in
#Text=Figure 11
#Text=, in which the bottom layer is the original laser point cloud .
#Text=Then a fixed number of laser points are selected as neighborhood points in different layers of the point cloud pyramid model .

#Text=After determining the neighborhood range of each laser point , feature extraction will be performed which includes statistical features , geometric morphological features , and histogram features .
